'''"Norman Keeps"''' was a [[Man]] living in the [[wikipedia:20th century|20th century]] [[wikipedia:England|England]].

== History ==
''Norman Keeps'' was not his actual name, but rather a nickname that [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham|Lowdham]] and [[Philip Frankley|Frankley]] gave him out of the [[Wikipedia:Keeps|Keeps]] he mentioned. He was their barber, and a nice and moderately intelligent men, but to him, everything that the "[[wikipedia:Dark Ages|Dark Ages]]" stood for were "[[Wikipedia:Keeps|Norman Keeps]]", "[[Wikipedia:King James|Them Jameses]]", "The Squires" and "The People".<ref>{{SD|65}}, pp. 230-1</ref>

== Inspiration ==
''Norman Keeps'' was an actual person, who expounded to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] the view of [[wikipedia:English history|English history]] as recounted by the eponymous character in the story. He was a barber too.<ref>{{SD|2dn}}, p. 283, note 15</ref>
